column4: So, I'm having a problem, I installed Azerus but everytime I start it, it closes just after it opens.
run it from the command line and see what errors you get
yeah, it seems the repo version is so out of date as to be laughable
kTorrent is a most excellent client, too
does your router fully support UPnP?
you'll probably have to forward ports that kTorrent uses to the IP your machine has. 6881-6889 are usually the safest bet.
I'm double checking my port fowarding, I'll be back in a sec.
I've got the port opened on my router, but it says its blacklisted.
MrElendig is right. it could be the ISP denying that port's traffic.
for my money, NOTHING beats BitTornado from the command line.
i think you're on the right track with kTorrent, then.
